> Well, nobody really needs to use any of the other methods from the outside.
> right now, that's what we have done: made those methods public so we can test
> them.
> but someone looking to use that class may get confused with all those methods.


- following the principle "code for an interface, not for an 
implementation", why don't you define an interface for this class? 
Methods can then be public an not accessible to the calling class

- transform the method in public static (you main class call them by 
passing class variables as parameters)

- move these methods to another public class, your main class can either 
encapsulate or extend your util class

- all, several or none of the above

-Vladimir
